message: This idea has been banging around in my head for a while : http://ptone.com/dablog/2011/02/broker-django-do-gooders/
@ptone Cool!  Glad to see you had some time for this.
neat idea using convore instead of comments as well
Wonder if creating such a place would be a worthy Django dash project - looking for input on whether folks feel it is realistic or feasible.
maybe this could be used to get designers for open source projects as well? :)
I'd also be up for it. Is there a "subscribe to topic" button anywhere around here? :)
I'd sign up.. Cognitive surplus and all that

This is a great idea. Django District - a user group in D.C. tried to do a project for Thanksgiving 2009. We called the event Djanksgiving. We picked a Saturday to hack away at a project & helped mentor. 

RE: "How to ensure that code quality is reasonable?"

Whoops... sent that too early... 
RE: How to ensure that code quality is reasonable?
Buddy system or Mentor?

RE: How to ensure that organizations that CAN afford to hire developrs do, and not take advantage.
Maybe some of these guys could help us with that?
http://www.charitynavigator.org/
http://volunteerguide.org/volunteer/charityratings.htm
http://www.charitywatch.org/
I think one of the major things to look at is administrative expenses.

Maybe there is a combination of points, between admin expenses, votes, level need for redesign or tool? Then the orgs with the highest combo win.

For the time being, I think we should start with http://www.brothersbrother.org/. They have a crappy website & they have the LOWEST admin expenses known for non-profits. That is 0.0%: http://finance.yahoo.com/family-home/article/111649/the-best-charities-in-america
Wow, that website could certainly use some (... lots of) work

@ptone I'd be sad to see the charities limited to US domestic organizations. Mostly cos I've never been to the US and hence don't know any of them :) I'd like to participate but I'm much more likely to get motivated if it's a charity I see every day
I think that this is a really cool idea, I think that givecamp sort of has figured out sorting needs into actionable items, maybe some people there would be helpful
Neat, I'm working on a regional one at http://weserveseo.org The wording and the region are specific to the NPO that we're working with on it
gcmartinelli Oh yeah?  what is it? (me too!)
I think it is an awesome idea and I'm working on something sorta similar (but not focused only on developers) as a learning project for Django!
I hope it works out! There are so many people willing to help but have no idea how to start and how to make it work with their interests, knowledge and available time.
btw, Akoha was developed in Django, I think
** @issackelly
the world needs all the help it can get. I'm building this as a non-profit and would totally apply for a "code-review" once I have something more concrete to show off :)
** @gcmartinelli
@issakelly after I begun work on it I found Akoha.com, it's kinda similar, but different... lol. More (non-financial) incentives for people
that is great :)
But otherwise, I think it's a cool start toward something bigger
